content.1: Moreover take thou up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,
content.3: And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.
content.4: The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.
content.5: Now when she saw that she had waited,
content.6: And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey,
content.7: And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fulness thereof, by the noise of his roaring.
content.8: Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.
content.9: And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.
content.11: And she had strong rods for the sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among the thick branches, and she appeared in her height with the multitude of her branches.
content.12: But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.
content.14: And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches,
